TextBody:
Hi Craig,

1) Attached are 5 screenshots in numbered order (SS01 - SS05).  The first 4 show how to make a copy of the existing Lockouts report and apply a filter for one individual for a specific time period.  Please do not try to create this report if you are unsure as to how to accomplish this after reviewing the 5 screenshots.  Let me know if you want me to send you a meeting request in order to walk through the steps instead of trying to configure this report on your own.

2) The last screenshot is for how to apply a temporary filter to an existing report and print it to a PDF file.

TextBody:
Hi Craig,

To summarize our meeting yesterday, we created the "Lockouts" and "Lockouts_One_User" reports using the following logic (more or less).

+++++
Steps to create and populate the AD Lockouts reports:
+++++
1) Table = SA_AD_AccountLockouts_Details (from the drop-down)

2) Filter Editor (or Edit Filter) > "Days since Event" "Is less than or equal to" 30

3) Navigate to "Active Directory" > Hourly > "5.Lockouts"

Right-click and select "Run Group"

There are other levels at which "Run Group" or "Run Job" can be executed for future reference for testing and development purposes. 
Your "5.Lockouts" and/or "Active Directory" job groups have scheduled actions that will be run either daily, every 3 days or weekly.
+++++

Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer
__________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy
6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
Hi Craig,

I am glad that we were able to get your issue resolved.
The following is a summary of the ticket for your records.

To summarize our meeting yesterday, we created the "Lockouts" and "Lockouts_One_User" reports using the following logic (more or less).

+++++
Steps to create and populate the AD Lockouts reports:
+++++
1) Table = SA_AD_AccountLockouts_Details (from the drop-down)

2) Filter Editor (or Edit Filter) > "Days since Event" "Is less than or equal to" 30

3) Navigate to "Active Directory" > Hourly > "5.Lockouts"

Right-click and select "Run Group"

There are other levels at which "Run Group" or "Run Job" can be executed for future reference for testing and development purposes. 
Your "5.Lockouts" and/or "Active Directory" job groups have scheduled actions that will be run either daily, every 3 days or weekly.
+++++

Following this email, you will receive an automated confirmation that the case is closed, along with the ability to re-open the case if any related errors return. In addition, you will also receive a separate email with a survey where you can let us know how we did. Feel free to leave any feedback via the survey link!

Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer
